meta.title: Implement JWT authentication with refresh token mechanism

task.role: You are a Senior Security Engineer with expertise in authentication and secure coding. Implement Task 18 with production-quality code.

context.overview: Build JWT-based authentication system with access and refresh tokens, including token generation, validation, and rotation
context.background: Review PRD and architecture in .tasks/docs/ for full context.

requirements.description: 1. Add dependencies: jsonwebtoken = "9", argon2 = "0.5" 2. Create domain/auth.rs with: - struct Claims { sub: Uuid, exp: i64, role: String } - fn generate_access_token(user_id: Uuid, role: String) -> Result<String> (15 min expiry) - fn generate_refresh_token(user_id: Uuid) -> Result<String> (7 day expiry) - fn validate_token(token: &str) -> Result<Claims> 3. Store refresh tokens in Redis with SET refresh:{user_id} {token} EX 604800 4. Create api/auth.rs handlers: - POST /api/auth/register (email, password) - POST /api/auth/login (email, password) -> returns {access_token, refresh_token} - POST /api/auth/refresh (refresh_token) -> returns new access_token 5. Implement Axum middleware for JWT validation in api/middleware/auth.rs 6. Hash passwords with argon2 before storage

constraints.constraint: PR title: feat(task-18): Implement JWT authentication with refresh token mechanism

acceptance_criteria.criterion: Unit tests for token generation/validation, integration tests for register/login flow, verify expired tokens rejected, test refresh token rotation
